objects.description: As a user, I have a choice between several web mail services or manually enter IMAP server information that i can send and receive email from.
objects.name: [Email] Add an AOL account on the device

steps.expected: The user is given the possibility to set up an account
steps.instruction: Open the Email app and choose to add a new email account. Choose "Choose "Manual Setup"

steps.expected: The account is set up or if the settings can't be set automatically the user can set up the account manually
steps.instruction: Enter valid AOL credentials and continue

steps.expected: All emails from the last 3 days (the default value) are synced to the device
steps.instruction: After the account is set up check that the emails are synced on the device

objects.description:
As a user, I have a choice between several webmail services or manually enter IMAP server information that i can send and receive email from.

Prerequisites: Have access to a hosted Microsoft Exchange 2003 (EAS2003) account
objects.name: [Email] Add an EAS2003 email account on the device

steps.expected: The user is given the possibility to set up an account
steps.instruction: Open the Email app and choose to add a new email account. Choose "Other Email"

steps.expected: Since the account is not public the user will have to enter manually the settings
steps.instruction: Enter valid credentials and continue

steps.expected: The user can set up the account
steps.instruction: Choose Activesync as account type and enter the host address

steps.expected: All emails from the last 3 days (the default value) are synced to the device
steps.instruction: After the account is set up check that the emails are synced on the device

objects.description:
As a user looking at the Compose Message screen I want to press the "Back" arrow button so that I can go back to the last view I was looking at previously

Prerequisites: Have an email account set up on the device
objects.name: [Email] Opting out of Compose View with no data entered in the email does not save the email in the Draft folder

steps.expected: The user is taken to the Email Compose View
steps.instruction: While in the account's Inbox View tap on the "+" button to start composing a new email

steps.expected: While there is no data entered in the email body the email is not saved in Drafts
steps.instruction: Press the "Back" button to exit the Email Compose View

objects.description:
As a user looking at the Compose Message screen I want to press the "Back" arrow button so that I can go back to the last view I was looking at previously. 

Prerequisites: Have an email account set up on the device.

steps.expected: The email is saved in the Drafts folder.

objects.name: Test that [Clock][Alarm] The alarm icon shows in the status bar when there is at least one alarm is on (multiple alarms case)

steps.expected: Then main page will show up
steps.instruction: When launch clock app from homescreen

steps.expected: Then the alarm setting page will show up
steps.instruction: When press the add alarm icon on the top-right corner

steps.expected: Then will go back to main page and the alarm will show in the main page, and the alarm icon will show on the status bar
steps.instruction: When press "Done" button

steps.expected: Then there will be three alarms shows in the alarm list with on state
steps.instruction: When repeat step 2. and 3. for two times

steps.expected: Then the alarm icon still shows in the status bar
steps.instruction: When turning off two of three the alarms

objects.description: User should be able to see that the alarm icon will not show in the status bar when all alarms are off
objects.name: Test that [Clock][Alarm] The alarm icon will not show in the status bar when all alarms are off (multiple alarms case)

steps.expected: Then main page will show up
steps.instruction: When launch clock app from homescreen

steps.expected: Then the alarm setting page will show up
steps.instruction: When press the add alarm icon on the top-right corner

steps.expected: Then will go back to main page and the alarm will show in the main page, and the alarm icon will show on the status bar
steps.instruction: When press "Done" button

steps.expected: Then there will be three alarms shows in the alarm list with on state
steps.instruction: When repeat step 2. and 3. for two times

steps.expected: Then see there is no alarm icon in the status bar
steps.instruction: When turning off all three alarms

objects.description: Test that a user can view two apps with a pop-up open within the task manager.

steps.expected: Then I should see each app in the task manager with the pop-up shown with the location bar seen and the web contents.
steps.instruction: Open up the task manager.

objects.description:
Test that I can receive an error when I access web content within a pop-up without a network connection.

#PRerequisites: User has a network connection on
objects.name: Error message displays when I access web content within a pop-up without a network connection

steps.instruction: Open the Browser App

steps.expected: User is brought to a Popup Test website with multiple links labeled "Good PopUp #1"
steps.instruction: Tap the URL bar. Enter the web address: http://www.popuptest.com/goodpopups.html

steps.expected: User is disconnected from the network connection(s)
steps.instruction: Pull down the Notifications Bar. Tap any connected network icons to disconnect them (Cell or Wi-Fi).

steps.expected: An error indicating that there is no network connection displays.
steps.instruction: Close the Notifications Bar. Select the link labeled "Good PopUp #1"

objects.description: User should be able to see that the alarm goes off without sound/vibration/page showing during the incoming call
objects.name: Test that [Clock][Alarm] Alarm will goes off without sound/vibration/page showing during the incoming call

steps.expected: Then main page of the clock app will show up
steps.instruction: When launch the clock app from the homescreen

steps.expected: Then the alarm setting page will show up
steps.instruction: When press the add alarm icon on the top-right corner

steps.expected: Then will go back to main page
steps.instruction: When set the alarm time and press "Done" button

steps.expected: Then the test device will keep ringing
steps.instruction: When make a call to the test device (before the alarm time) and wait for the alarm time

steps.expected: Then see the alarm won't goes off with sound/vibration and even the alarm page won't show on the screen
steps.instruction: When reach the alarm time

steps.expected: Then will see the alarm page shows on the screen
steps.instruction: When cancel the incoming call

objects.description:
User should be able to see that the alarm goes off with mute showing during the active call.

Please see these issues:

https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1026167
objects.name: Test that [Clock][Alarm] Alarm will go off with mute showing during the active call

steps.expected: Then main page of the clock app will show up.
steps.instruction: Launch the clock app from the homescreen.

steps.expected: The alarm setting page will show up
steps.instruction: Press the add alarm icon on the top-right corner.

steps.expected: The user will go back to main page.
steps.instruction: Set the alarm time and press "Done" button.

steps.expected: Test device is in an active call.
steps.instruction: Accept a phone call from another device (before the alarm time) and wait for the alarm to go off.

steps.expected: Then the user will see the alarm go off with mute and the alarm page is shown on the screen. (Vibration will only happen if vibration is enabled in settings)
steps.instruction: When the alarm goes off.

steps.expected: Then the user will see the alarm page with sound on the screen.
steps.instruction: When the user closes the active call and tap the alarm in Notifications.

steps.instruction:
1- Open the application UI test
2- Select Keyboard test
3- Click on the field (input type = "text")
4- Press the key "?123"
5- Pres the key "#+="
6- Press the keys " '?', '!', '«', '»', '"', ''' and '*' "

tags.description:
If this is the "Keyboard" test suite, you should have the "UI Test App".  Install it as follows:

1. Connect to the internet on your phone via WiFi or Data. 
2. Go to http://mozqa.com/webapi-permissions-tests/ in your B2G Browser.
3. scroll down to "Packaged App Test Case 13"
4. Click "Install Packaged App" button on the page.
5. The "UI Test" app should appear on your homescreen.

(Please disregard this step if this is "Keyboard & Text Handling" or any other suite).
tags.name: keyboard

objects.name: Verify that the keyboard is opened by clicking on a field input type="search"

steps.expected: The text keyboard is open
steps.instruction:
1- Open the application UI test
2- Select Keyboard test
3- Click on the field (input type = "search")

tags.description:
If this is the "Keyboard" test suite, you should have the "UI Test App".  Install it as follows:

1. Connect to the internet on your phone via WiFi or Data. 
2. Go to http://mozqa.com/webapi-permissions-tests/ in your B2G Browser.
3. scroll down to "Packaged App Test Case 13"
4. Click "Install Packaged App" button on the page.
5. The "UI Test" app should appear on your homescreen.

(Please disregard this step if this is "Keyboard & Text Handling" or any other suite).

1. Connect to the internet on your phone via WiFi or Data. 
2. Go to http://mozqa.com/webapi-permissions-tests/ in your B2G Browser.
3. scroll down to "Packaged App Test Case 13"
4. Click "Install Packaged App" button on the page.
5. The "UI Test" app should appear on your homescreen.

(Please disregard this step if this is "Keyboard & Text Handling" or any other suite).
tags.name: keyboard

5- Hold pressing the key "C"
6- Drop the key without selecting anything

-----------------
Have a valid contact on the device
objects.name: Verify the special character "~" can be used

Select the Create message icon (box and pencil)

steps.expected: Keyboard is presented
steps.instruction: Select the Message field
Select the "?123" button

steps.expected: Special character "~" should display on the keyboard
steps.instruction: Select the ALT button on the keypad

steps.expected: Special character  "~" is displayed inside the text message and can be sent
steps.instruction: Type special character  "~"

1. Connect to the internet on your phone via WiFi or Data. 
2. Go to http://mozqa.com/webapi-permissions-tests/ in your B2G Browser.
3. scroll down to "Packaged App Test Case 13"
4. Click "Install Packaged App" button on the page.
5. The "UI Test" app should appear on your homescreen.

(Please disregard this step if this is "Keyboard & Text Handling" or any other suite).
tags.name: keyboard

2. Go to http://mozqa.com/webapi-permissions-tests/ in your B2G Browser.
3. scroll down to "Packaged App Test Case 13"
4. Click "Install Packaged App" button on the page.
5. The "UI Test" app should appear on your homescreen.

(Please disregard this step if this is "Keyboard & Text Handling" or any other suite).
